intro: Amorpha curtisii, commonly known as the narrowleaf false indigo, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy blue to purple flowers. The plant has a deep taproot system, making it drought-tolerant and suitable for xeriscaping. It produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds, aiding in its propagation. Amorpha curtisii is often used in wildlife habitats due to its ability to provide food and shelter for various animals.
